title: n-th Prime
content: **nthPrime n** is the n-th prime (0-indexed). Uses Nat.nth to enumerate elements satisfying Nat.Prime.

title: Prime Gap
content: **primeGap n** = p_{n+1} - p_n, the gap between consecutive primes. The problem concerns large gaps.

title: Natural Logarithm
content: **lg x** = log(x), the natural logarithm. Foundation for iterated logs.

title: Iterated Logarithms
content: **lg2, lg3, lg4** are log(log(x)), log(log(log(x))), etc. These appear in the Erdős bound.

title: Erdős Function
content: **erdosFunction n** = (lg2·lg4)/(lg3)²·lg n. This is the target lower bound for prime gaps.

title: Rankin Function
content: **rankinFunction n** = (lg2)/(lg3)·lg n. Simplified version without the lg4 term.

title: Erdős Problem 4 (SOLVED)
content: **erdos_4_conjecture**: For any C > 0, infinitely many n have primeGap n > C · erdosFunction n.

title: Rankin's Theorem (1938)
content: **Rankin**: There exists some C > 0 achieving the bound. First quantitative result on large prime gaps.

title: Maynard's Theorem (2016)
content: **Maynard**: Proved for ALL C > 0. This solves Erdős Problem 4 affirmatively.

title: Ford-Green-Konyagin-Tao (2016)
content: **FGKT**: Independent proof of the same result as Maynard. Two teams solved it simultaneously.

title: Problem Solved
content: **erdos_4_solved**: The conjecture is true, witnessed by Maynard's theorem.

title: FGKMT Improved Bound (2018)
content: **Ford-Green-Konyagin-Maynard-Tao**: All five authors proved a stronger bound with lg3(n) instead of lg3(n)².

title: Baker-Harman-Pintz (2001)
content: **BHP Upper Bound**: primeGap n ≤ n^{0.525} for large n. Best known upper bound on prime gaps.

title: Cramér's Conjecture (OPEN)
content: **Cramér (1936)**: p_{n+1} - p_n = O((log p_n)²). The conjectured true upper bound, still OPEN.

title: Cramér-Granville Constant
content: **Refined conjecture**: lim sup of gaps/(log p)² is 2e^{-γ} ≈ 1.1229, not 1.

title: First Prime Gap
content: **gap_0**: primeGap 0 = 1 (i.e., 3 - 2 = 1). The smallest prime gap.

title: Gaps are Positive
content: Prime gaps are always positive since primes are strictly increasing.

title: Average Gap Asymptotic
content: The average gap near n is approximately log n (Prime Number Theorem).

title: Erdős Function Growth
content: **erdosFunction** grows slower than (log n)^{1+ε} for any ε > 0.

title: Stronger Conjecture ($10,000)
content: **erdos_stronger_conjecture**: gaps > (log n)^{1+c} for some c > 0. Erdős offered $10,000 for this.

title: Firoozbakht's Conjecture (OPEN)
content: **Firoozbakht (1982)**: p_n^{1/n} is strictly decreasing. Implies gaps < (log p)² - log p.
